XsRange Class Reference

A class whose objects can be used to store a range. It provides method to check whether a value is inside the range. More...

Public Member Functions

 XsRange (int f=0, int l=-1)
 Constructs a range starting at f and ending at l. Default values are 0 and -1 respectively.
 
 XsRange (const XsRange &other)
 Constructs a range based upon other.
 
XsRange & operator= (const XsRange &other)
 Assigns the range other to this.
 
int count () const
 Get the number of values in the range.
 
int interval () const
 Get the number of values in the range.
 
bool contains (int i) const
 Test if the range contains the given value i.
 
void setRange (int f, int l)
 Set the range to f - l.
 
bool empty () const
 Test if the range is empty.
 
int first () const
 Return the first value of the range.
 
int last () const
 Return the last value of the range.
 
bool operator== (const XsRange &other) const
 Return true if this is equal to other.
 
bool operator< (const XsRange &other) const
 Return true if start of this is less than start of other.

Detailed Description

A class whose objects can be used to store a range. It provides method to check whether a value is inside the range.
